sn7.3:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrels’ feeding ground.
sn7.3:1.2: The brahmin Bharadvāja the Fiend heard a rumor effect that
sn7.3:1.3: a brahmin of the Bharadvāja clan had gone forth from the lay life to homelessness in the presence of the ascetic Gotama. Angry and displeased he went to the Buddha and abused and insulted him with rude, harsh words.
sn7.3:1.4: But when he said this, the Buddha kept silent.
sn7.3:1.5: Then Bharadvāja the Fiend said to the Buddha,
sn7.3:3.1: When you get angry at an angry person
sn7.3:3.2: you just make things worse for yourself.
sn7.3:3.3: When you don’t get angry at an angry person
sn7.3:3.4: you win a battle hard to win.
sn7.3:4.1: When you know that the other is angry,
sn7.3:4.2: you act for the good of both
sn7.3:4.4: if you’re mindful and stay calm.
sn7.3:6.1: When he had spoken, Bharadvāja the Fiend said to the Buddha,
sn7.3:6.4: And Venerable Bhāradvāja became one of the perfected.
